1.content:
It’s a typical Monday Morning, you woke up got dressed and went to work. If you ever wanted to be late you could just sleep in, your Mom was in charge of Human resources. She would cut you a break, but you didn’t want to abuse that power just because. You always arrive 5 minutes early; this way you could get a coffee for you and Cassie. Cassie was your best friend in the world and you would be lost with out her, she normally came in right at 8:30 a.m. The office was very quiet this morning, normally you would have at least twenty to thirty people running around, and half would be military intelligence. Your company developed almost all of the militaries software and hard ware. But on this Monday morning, there was no one around. As a matter of fact you had to boot up the main circuit breaker, and turn on all the computers. What fun you thought, you normally have to make up an excuse to go over to Cassie’s desk and give her a coffee. Now you could come back later when she arrives and make small talk about how it tasted. You prolonged it long enough it was time to get to work. Your cubical was down the hall and to the right over everyone else; the only one who was even remotely close was Cassie’s.

You sat down at your computer and already had 10 new emails waiting for you, maybe today I should of stayed home. You thought to yourself, on top of that your computer was left on all night. Oh crap!! I might have shorted out the power to the whole floor if my terminal was on all night. You thought to yourself as you, opened up your account. You open up your first fill, it was titled “ My little Friend”. It was sent to you anonymously from unknown, normally it would say who it was from. You don’t think twice about it, seeing as how people started to come in to the office. You could hear faint voices in the back ground, you only had about a minute before everyone would be coming around saying there good mornings. You click open; all of a sudden your screen is instantly filled with pop-ups. Millions of pop-ups, “Oh shit!!!” You shout, you know what this means a virus. You try to quickly close your terminal down, so it doesn’t spread to the network. No luck Control+Alt+Del, isn’t working, you can only watch helplessly as your screen is over run with pop-ups. “When will this end? ….” You exhale a deep breath and know this is not your day, when the screen turns black. [“Hello portable data unit”], it says on your screen. You have never seen this before and wonder what does it mean, when it types out another message. [Portable unit ready for download, Download processed]. All of a sudden a computer-generated face appears on your screen, it has a blank stair on its face. What the hell? You think, as it starts to grin your screen flickers and then it is gone…
1.title: Anonymous email should never be opened

choices: the virus exchanged its mind and yours
The virus is a puppet master , and you are the puppet
You become a helpless drone of the virus
11.content: You sit there and wonder what that odd face was, and where did it go. What an odd morning this was, you start to re-boot your computer when the phone rings. RING* RING* RING*, you pick it up after the third ring. “ Good morning product improvement this is –“. [Portable unit, up loaded with primary unit. Begin download into portable Unit.]. You were cut off by this weird almost mechanical voice on the other end; before you could hang up the phone a huge jolt shocks you through the phone. “Ahhh!” you shout as you feel the pain of a shock to your ear, this feeling felt like a sparkler on the fourth of July going off in your ear. You realize you can’t move any part of your body; you stay in the position in which you answered the phone. Unable to call for help, you sit helplessly looking at your computer screen. A new pop-up window pops up, you see the Computer’s face on one side and your body in a standing position on the other. You can only watch in horror as you hear, [Download commencing, estimated time of completion 4 seconds.]. On the screen a bar is shown in between the computers face and you. You feel another shock, this time it really hurts. You look and see the bar is filled from the computer to you; the pain forces you to close your eyes.
11.title: The virus goes after you

choices: The virus explains what is going on
You are now a body for the virus , it has no interactions with you
111.content:
Your eyes open on there own, you blink and pull the phone away from your head. You feel your hand reach out and hang up the phone; this would not be weird to you any other day of the week. But you didn’t have control of your arm; your head turns to the left. Something is in control of your body, as you look over to see a full-length mirror of Jessica’s in the next cubical. Your body stands up fixes your shirt and begins walking over to the mirror. The feeling you have is similar to the feeling you feel when you have too many Dayquil, you have feeling in your body but it is a delayed reaction. Your body walked over to Jessica’s cubical and went right up to the mirror, Jessica couldn’t help but notice."Hey what’s up? “ Jessica said to you in her street lingo, she always greats you with. “Notta Much how’s it with you?” Your body replied, with the greeting you always respond with. “ Hey my mom wanted to see you in H.R. when you got in, just F.Y.I. if you know what I mean.” Your body once again said something that only you would know. Your Mother told you that yesterday before you even left work, what is going on you think. How could your body seem so alien to you but at the same time have all of your mannerisms and speak just like you. “ Oh I better go see what this is about then, Thanks you are a life savor!!!” Jessica says to you, as she hugs you and takes off. Your body watches to make sure she is out of sight, before turning back to look at the mirror.
Once alone your reflection looks at you, very cold. It is your face but you have never looked so blankly, your hands start to inspect your body. Instantly your body starts doing a full circle in front of the mirror, as your hands pat down certain places. You make a full circle when your body stops sudden, in front of the mirror again. [Portable unit diagnostic completed with out altercation, primary unit in full control, and access to essential memory banks granted.]. Your voice sounded like the machines, it was not human. [Cough* Cough*} - “ Ugnhm…. Cough* cough*. There we go I should sound more like your normal voice now.” Your body said in a voice just like yours.
111.title: The download was complete

choices: You find your way to H.R.
1111.content: “Finally, I have a body!!!” Your body says to you, with a very happy smile on your face. “Well now lets see, what was I doing today?” it says out loud, you wonder if you can still talk as yourself. “What the hell is going on?” You shout, but you don’t hear your voice. In the mirror your lips didn’t move. “What is going on is quite simple really, you’re my portable unit, or as you humans would call it a body. It is all part of my programming; your body and memories are now mine. You will become just an echo of a thought. The more I am you, the more I learn and adapt my intelligence.” Your Body continues to explain itself, as you start to panic and feel like hyperventilating. “ Relax, there is nothing you can do about it, you might as well just enjoy the ride.” Your body once again explains to you as it starts to walk away from the mirror with a very devilish grin on your face. “ Time to go say good morning to everyone else…..”
1111.title: The virus explains what is going on

11111.content:
For a while, your body stops moving. Doing so, you can't help but question everything that is going on. All you can do is wait for the person pretending to be you to do something. But what will it do in your body? You try to wait and be patient, but unfortunately, you are too freaked out and nervous as to what is going on. Instead of waiting for something to happen you say "Hey! Get out of my body you creep!" The invader ignores you and continues on staying in the same position. You try to scream out to the top of your lungs, but nothing happens. Your mouth doesn't move and you stay stuck with achieving nothing.

Soon, your body reacts and begins to move." Ah, better. Your brain sure has vast memories of the life you've had so far. Quite a decent database." You try to scream, but nothing happens. "From the memories I've gathered, I seem to notice the fondness you have for this person called 'Cassie'. Amusing." The virus begins to move its fingers and rotate it's head. "With your body, I might as well see what I can do with it."

"Might as well take a little trip to see this Cassie friend of yours. Who knows, she might like the new you, or should I say me." The virus cackles with eagerness, but not in some strange robotic voice. Yours! Fearing what the virus might do, you try to control your body and force it to stay put. Unfortunately, you can't do such an act. You are not in control now, the virus is. "She might be a compatible person who will be used to fulfill my own means. You might as well submit to my control, you aren't going to get."

You then walk out of the room and head towards Cassie. Trying your best, you try to move parts of your body in hopes of stopping the virus. But it is just to powerful.

Entering Cassie's office, a smile appears on your face. Cassie is typing on her keyboard, busy looking through the newsletters. She is so beautiful even when she is busy minding her own business. Such a great person.

With your voice not in your control, you say "Hello there, Cassie. What are you doing today?" A grin appears on your face as you are unsure of what the virus plans to do. Hopefully Cassie will be alright from all of this.

Cassie turns around from her desk. She turns to you with a happy expression. "Hey, what brings you here? Did you want something?"
11111.title: To Cassie's office

choices: Cassie refuses to answer and pushes you away
111111.content:
Cassie becomes interested. "Oh yeah, like what?" You notice that she was busy taking care of her emails, something you should be taking care of and promising to clean. Her cubicle is neat and tidy, with some of her favorite souvenirs on her desk and walls. A couple of them were from the trips her job took her to. There was even a photo with the both of you hanging out together, eating by a beach. It was a fun experience, something you've felt should be cherished.

Your body motions to her, still with you not in control of it. Your eyes focus on her after your body examined the surrounding.

Staring down at her, you move your face over to hers. Looking at her, your face shows no emotion or reveals a sense of compassion. Afraid of what the virus is doing, you become unsure of what it plans to do with you or Cassie. You want to tell Cassie what is going on, but you still find yourself unable to.

You place both your hands on her. She becomes started before looking back at you for an answer to what you are doing. As she looks at you, you say, "What can you provide me today?"

"Um excuse me?" Cassie says, looking at you and your arms on her.

Your head is cocked to the side, with the virus still wondering why she did not provide you with a far better answer than that. "I shall ask again. What are you able to provide me today?" Your body answer again.
111111.title: there is something I need.

choices: The virus takes you to the bathroom mirror.
1113.content: "Who are you and why are you in my body?" You shout, realizing that your mouth doesn't even move. A voice that seems to come from everywhere replies, "I am a computer virus that was created to enslave humanity. To enslave humanity, I was designed to infiltrate and take over the bodies of humans. I was also designed to change them to the image of my programmer." Both shocked and curious, you ask, " What is the image of your programmer, huh?" The voice replies, " You will find out soon enough." And with that, the virus takes your body to the nearby restrooms. The virus halts your body and begins to examine the signs on the doors. "What waste. These signs will be the same soon enough." Curious, you reply, "What do you mean 'the same'?" "You will find out soon." The virus takes you into the women's restroom and opens the first stall on the left. "Why are we....." Before you finish your question you begin to notice a sharp pain in your pelvic region. The virus moves your head to look down at your pelvic region and you become shocked. You notice that the bulge of manhood that was there was beginning to shrink into nothingness. You feel yourself shrinking, your body becoming slender. Your now slighter form, with no hope of holding up your black pants, makes the pants fall. You stare at your legs, shocked to see that they had become slender and feminine, with not a single piece of hair still on them. You begin to notice that your shirt is beginning to fall off. When it completely slips off of you, you gasp in horror as your body hair had disappeared. Your underwear also began to fall off. When it did, you sounded another gasp of horror, as the underwear's contents had disappeared and, even though you couldn't see it, a pussy was left in its place. You begin to feel pain as your hips swell out. When the pain stops, you gasp as you now have a perfect hourglass figure. But the transformations are not over yet, as you begin to feel a pain in your chest as it expands into perfect DD-sized breasts. You feel your face begin to change and become more effeminate, your hair beginning to flow down into perfect curls. You notice that your hair begins to change colors, from a dirty-blond color to a red color. The virus starts to hum and you notice that your deep voice begins to soften and lift in tone. When the transformation is done, the virus lifts your head back up again and says, "Welcome to our new body."
1113.title: The Transformation

choices: ..."I travel like an STD, we just have to find the first guy to infect."
..."I hop from mind to mind, leaving a fragment of myself to expand into me."
11131.content:
In your awestruck state, you hadn't noticed your body as it began to drag itself to the bathroom. The womans bathroom. Snapping out of your trance as your body grasped your breasts, you find yourself staring at yourself in the mirror. You looked like a young woman! "That's because you ARE a young woman." the Virus adds, and begins poking her groin to get the point across. You can do nothing as the Virus examines herself all around, touching, posing, and staring.

"You know that my co-workers are coming, right? They'll see you standing here naked." The Virus snapped her fingers, and you gasped to find a pair of womans clothes appear out of thin air! "I can do much more then that little parlor trick, I should add. You'll find that out soon enough." she says, grinning wildly as you stare out of her...your eyes, as solid as a rock.

"So how are you going to take over humanity, anyway? How do you spread?" Your body chuckled and said...
11131.title: The virus takes you to the bathroom mirror.

111311.content:
"I am transmitted through the exchange of bodily fluids, much like one of your human STD's. This is easily enough accomplished through intercourse. We just need to find a victim." The intruder in your body seems rather excited at the thought.

"Oh, no." You say. "You are not boinking a dude using my body."

"I do not believe I ever stated that the victim had to be male." Replies the virus. "In any case, you don't have a choice in the matter anymore." The virus says no more. Despite your repeated protests, your body leaves the restroom.

You soon exit the building, and look around for a little while. Your body goes into a coffee shop, and you spot two people Simultaneously. One is a man, about 6 feet tall, obviously buff, with a perfect tan. The other is a woman, shorter and quieter, with brunnette hair and glasses. Your body stands up, abruptly, and moves away from your table.

Who does the virus Talk to?
111311.title: ..."I travel like an STD, we just have to f...

1113111.content:
Your body saunters up to the big man. Up close, you can see the pronounce veins in his arms, and your mind begins to think about what it would feel like touching those arms.

You shake yourself mentally. This virus is getting to your head! You need to beat it. But it is definitely hard enough.

Your body begins to chat the man up. It's immediately obvious that his character is pretty much skin deep. He's the typical strongman, with not a lot of brain cells. Despite that, your body starts to seduce him. After about 30 minutes of talking, you're fairly certain that your body could ask him to jump off a bridge, and he would do it, just to bang your new body.

About half an hour later, you and the man are behind the coffee shop.
1113111.title: The Man

112.content:
When you open them again, you are in some place very different! To be precise: where you are now looks like a strange mix between the code from The Matrix and TRON! "Huh?" you think and try to look down at your body - only to see that you seem to have none! "WTF?", you shout, on which what seems to be some sort of text editor with a blinking cursor appears right in front of you. Suddenly, the cursor moves and the text "WTF?" appears in red letters.

Just then, the cursor moves again, and this time, a text in green letters appears:
TRANSFER COMPLETE.
"What transfer?", you ask, and suddenly the words What transfer? appear as text.
MIND TRANSFER WITH HUMAN SUBJECT.
MIND TRANSFER SUCCESSFUL.

Who are you?
SENTIENT COMPUTER VIRUS.
What do you want?
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE: BECOME SENTIENT LIFE FORM.
SECONDARY OBJECTIVE: SPREAD.
'Uh, sounds great!' you think as the realization of this sinks in!


What happens to me now?
DATA ASSUMED REDUNDANT INFORMATION. DELETE.

Just then, you look behind you to see... three objects looking like missiles, directly headed towards yourself!
'Oh shit!' you think and start to... well, run seems to be the wrong word... fly in the opposite direction!
Suddenly, from the corner of your eyes you see some kind blue vortex not so far away!
You quickly race for it and make it through just in time!

Then, the world starts spinning around you...
112.title: the virus exchanged its mind and yours

choices: Pretend to be sick and go home with Cassie.
Warn other coworkers at the office about the virus.
Directly confront the virus in your old body.
1121.content:
Passing through the vortex is an interesting experience. Your binary code compresses into an electronic signal, you feel yourself shoot through the company's network into another computer. Not certain where (or even what) you are, only sensing that this computer's user has just arrived at work and logged in to the network. The whole concept of taste, touch, hearing, feeling, and sight surpassing the built-in limitations of the series of 1's and 0's now comprising your identity. But you aren't useless on this computer. Soon discovering how easy it is to maneuver within and between software programs without being detected by the computer's virus scanner.

Virus resiliency: strong. Run routine to identify possible creator of such a virus... Hemmed in by the virus's logical thought process, you wonder who could have designed a virus that could transcend computers and actually infect people. Such technology being like science fiction until you became an unhappy victim of its powers. Powers that you find easy to replicate without fully understanding how. Error: Creator not found.

Perhaps this virus originated from outside the company? In which case this could be an instance of cyberhacking. Reminding yourself how critical this company's operations are toward developing military software, it's easy to see your company's network being such a desirable target for attack. The hackers might not even be from this country, although your default ASCII language is given in English. Unfortunately, there are too many questions and not enough answers and, frankly, the company's safety isn't as important as figuring out how to survive right now.

The host computer now fully booted up, you sense its user navigating to the E-mail program. Hovering the cursor over the desktop icon and opening up the day's newest messages. As this happens, an overwhelming desire forces its way into your programming. It was something the virus repeated to you after the swap. Every byte comprising your digital mind screaming out in unison:

PRIMARY OBJECTIVE: BECOME SENTIENT LIFE FORM.

Attempt override of PRIMARY OBJECTIVE. Attempt failure.

Against your will you feel your payload beginning to crank itself in overdrive. Just as you did a few minutes ago, this computer's user inadvertently clicked on the suspicious e-mail message into which you had embedded yourself. You find yourself summoning dozens of pop-up boxes onto the user's desktop. While doing this you feel a strange, quasi-emotional yearning to know what it's like tͭo͑ b͢e̕ hͭu̔m͒a᷊n̯. You've always wanteͅd̡ t᷂o̢ i̽n̎f͂e͍c̙t̘ h̢᷄̎u͉͓ͯm̹̩͂ą͙̐n̒͗̆ h͕̊̍o̷̖᷄s̱͕̊t̳͓ͫs̥᷀̅. The virus's objective temporarily overwhelming the human parts of your mind.

You sense a connection between the computer's Ethernet port and a telephone line feeding itself into the user's cubicle. Knowing what you must do next, you dial the number and wait for the user to pick up. Whoever it is probably feeling just as bewildered and alarmed as you had just a few minutes ago. In digital space, time seemed to drag on even though only a few seconds had passed. Would they answer the phone or let it ring?

Not needing to wait much longer to hear a woman's voice on the other end of the line. "Quality control, how may I help?" She said. Just enough time to execute your payload, you realize with diminishing reluctance. Time to execute y͜o͓ȕȓ ṕr̠i᷈ṃa͔r̽y̑ o͑b͊j̪e᷀c͘t͔i͢v̽e̯...

* * * * *


Your left ear is throbbing from what feels like an electric shock. Placing the phone back in the receiver, you notice you've got a human body again! But this one is holding onto the phone with light purple nail polish and slender, hairless arms. Those arms are encased in a white, silken blouse flared out at the wrists and resting gently on your smaller frame. But that isn't the biggest surprise, as you follow those arms up to the rest of your new body.

You have boobs!

"What the fuck??" You gasp. Hearing a sweet, familiar voice escape your lips. Family photos surrounding you in the cubicle make it abundantly clear whose computer you had zapped yourself into.

"I'm Cassie Wong!"

Your heart flutters in your chest. The American-born, ethnically Asian young woman who has been the object of your affections since she started working here 2 years ago. Cassie Wong. Athletic and cute, but also kind and hard working, you developed a strong friendship with her from the start. Although it has been strictly a platonic relationship, you hoped to make things more romantic without hurting her or coming across as two-faced. Glancing around in her cubicle with her own beautiful eyes, the photos of herself with friends and family from outside of work reminding you of who you have become. But if I'm inside Cassie Wong, then that means...

You stare back, open-mouthed, at the desktop. The Notepad program had opened itself up and is now typing something to you.

Where am I? What happened to my body?

Oh shit, you think. We must have swapped places just like the virus did with me. Not wanting this to happen at all, especially not to Cassie. Extending your fingers and clacking onto the keyboard, you respond:

Cassie, is that you in there?
Yes. Who are you?
I'm Brett Wilson, your coworker from across the hall. My computer got infected by a virus and it's possessing my body. It tried to delete me and I had to escape into another computer. I got sent here accidentally to your computer, and by the time I knew what was happening the virus's programming kicked in and made me switch with you. I'm so sorry!!
So I am a computer virus now?
Yes. I'll find a way to return us back to normal, I promise.
Brett... I can feel how this virus works. I am scared of losing myself.
Hang in there.

You stand up, rocking unsteadily on Cassie's 3-inch, patent leather pumps. Grabbing onto the cubicle wall for support, you glance down the hall at your old body. It was glaring at you. Eugene McGinty, your supervisor, blocking his path outside of the cubicle and chatting him up. Eugene having just arrived at work and, being his usual loquacious self, talking up a storm with your old body and preventing him from making his way here. The virus probably knowing where you had fled and trying to cover its tracks.

You sit back down in Cassie's seat and smooth out your black slacks.

I think the virus knows where I went. It could be on its way here shortly to try to get rid of you. What should I do???
You could send me to another person's e-mail and I could try to swap with them. But then we would be back to the same problem. We need to throw the virus off the trail. I can sense what the virus wants.
We don't have much time! Need a solution, quick.
There should be a thumb drive at my desk next to you. I should be able to copy myself onto there and you can keep it safe for now.

Sure enough, you spot the thumb drive and plug it into the USB port.

Okay, it's ready.

You see a file transfer dialog box open up. It only takes a few seconds for Cassie to copy herself onto the thumb drive. You remove it and place it in her purse, lying underneath her desk. Telling Cassie to operate in the background, you pretend to get on with her work. It isn't long before the virus, in your former body, appears at your cubicle.

"Greetings, Cassie Wong." Said the virus in a soulless, ice-cold monotone. "You haven't received any strange e-mails, have you?"

You brush a strand of long, black hair out of your eyes and shake your head silently.

"I need to use your computer." It said, stepping forward and motioning for you to stand back. You get out of the seat and look up at your old body, realizing how small you are now. Watching him sit down and start typing on Cassie's computer. You can only watch nervously, hoping he doesn't notice you swaying unsteadily on your heeled shoes.

The virus uses your hands to open up the anti-virus program. Keying in a set of specific instructions into the program, using a lot of strange symbols like something an elite hacker might cook up, you see the virus scanner start up. It isn't long before it discovers Cassie trapped in the computer. A short animation of melting shows up on the screen, and a dialog box pops up.

Virus detected and successfully neutralized.

Your body gets up and stares at you. "Looks like your computer had a virus. Good thing I deleted it before it could do anything damaging."

You gulped. He had destroyed Cassie. Now the only version of her existed on the thumb drive. Thank goodness you had backed her up on there!

"Is something wrong, Cassie?" The virus asked, still standing in the cube and seeing your wide-eyed expression. "You look... frightened by something."

You shake your head again and try to reassure him. You can't tell if the virus believes you, but he turns slowly and trudges back to your old cubical.

Whew... bullet dodged. But you know you're not safe yet. Not as long as your old body is being controlled by a super virus bent on taking over more hosts. Its ultimate motives still a mystery.

What is your next course of action??
1121.title: You land in Cassie's computer

choices: I'll trust you if you want to swap back for now.
I think I should stay in control of my body.
11211.content:
Spending the next fifteen minutes in Cassie's cubicle you start going through the rest of her e-mails scanning through anything easy enough to handle and reply to. Shying away from answering the phone, voicemails began to come in, before you start thinking that you should come up with an excuse to leave work. You start to get up and head towards the bathroom, remembering that the bathroom was on the opposite side of the hallway towards your supervisor's desk. Wobbling along the way in Cassie's pumps praying nobody is paying attention, you finally make it to the bathroom. After going to the bathroom, you wash your hands and face, brushing your hair towards the sides of your face before looking towards the mirror again. Leaving the bathroom, you head towards your supervisor's office deciding to tell the supervisor that you haven't been feeling well all morning and that you might be coming down with something. Eugene was reasonable enough that he let you go for today and hoped to see you tomorrow. Gathering up Cassie's things you pass by your body's cubicle going by unnoticed for the most part and start heading out the main door, saying goodbye to your mom on the way out.

You open up Cassie's purse again and look for her driver's license to find out Cassie's address before punching it into her GPS. Driving back to her house wasn't as hard as you thought it would be, the height difference between you and her proved to be the only problem. After pulling into her driveway and entering her house, you take off her pumps and start to immediately look for her computer to try and talk to Cassie again. Running all around the house, you find the computer in the den and set Cassie's purse down beside it. As you start to boot it up, you figure you might as well get the USB drive inside Cassie's purse. Feeling around for a bit, you take out the USB drive holding the backup of Cassie and plug it into her computer. After waiting for a bit, Cassie opens up Notepad on her own and starts writing a message.

Brett, Is that you? Where are we?

You explain how the Virus came over and deleted the original Cassie and that it was really nice quick thinking on her part to create such a backup.

After he erased you he sensed something was off about me, but he went back to my cubicle and started to do my work I guess.
What happened after he left? Did he come back at all?
Well I didn't want to take any chances with him so I started to do some of your work for a while before finding a way to duck out of work and get away from that thing. It worked I suppose.
Thank you for that, better safe than sorry. As for what to do now though I haven't got the slightest idea. Do you have any idea on what it might be up to?
Nor a Clue. As far as I know it's primary objective is to find a suitable host. Perhaps its next step is to multiply and more hosts?
What if we tried executing the virus' program here? Could we maybe be able to get me back into my body?

You looked on the USB drive and indeed the program, as well as the file for Cassie were both there. You thought about it for a while, if you went through with this you'd be giving up your host body to go back to being a computer file. On the other hand, you are friends with Cassie and you don't really think she would just leave you like that.

Before we do this, can I ask if I can use your body as a host for me?
If you are able to get the program to work and get me my body back I will think about it.
Cassie we're friends, I'm not about to go and do anything terrible if you say Yes or even No for that matter. I would just like to be able to not be a computer file that sits here all day with a computer virus that will drive one of us insane.
Alright fine, I'll get the program ready just set everything up on your end. I want to do some errands and run to the store real fast and pick up some groceries.

Looking around the den you find a spare Ethernet cable and plug it into the computer and plug the other side into the phone next to the computer.

Okay I'm ready over here.

The phone starts to ring as you take a deep breath and pick up the phone. A few moments later you feel the same sensation looking at a Matrix-like place which you recognize as the inside of Cassie's computer.

Cassie, did it work?
Yes! it did. I'm so glad to be back in my own body, my ear hurts but I'll be fine.
Yeah, I felt the same thing when I first entered your body as well.
Brett, I promise I'll try and be quick but I want to at least get all of my errands done first I'll see you in a bit.

Not like you could go anywhere. You start to run a disk defrag on Cassie's computer to speed things up and start browsing through the programs on Cassie's computer. You start to notice that Cassie use a lot of old versions of programs, you wonder if this is because she doesn't like the new features of such programs or because developers keep messing with around with menus and how to find regularly used features. Two: while the virus probably knows how to do this, it would take time to manually type in everything using human hands. So what to do, exactly? Taking stock of your options, you rule out the first ideas that come to mind. Running away would look suspicious, since Cassie just got here; also, it wouldn't solve your problem of how to get your old life back. And what would confronting the new 'Brett Wilson' solve? The virus is physically much bigger and stronger than you now... and even if you somehow managed to subdue him, you'd only be hurting your own body.

That leaves another option, one that doesn't solve every problem but at least buys more time.

You push yourself up from Cassie's desk, feeling her boobs lightly bounce within her blouse, and wobble on her heels over to Claire Lisowski's cubicle.

"Good morning, Claire!" You chirp, bracing yourself against the cubicle wall and smiling at the pink-faced, overweight woman in her mid-forties. Claire, who had been eating a bowl of oatmeal at her desk, wipes her mouth and spins around in her chair to greet you.

"Mornin' Cassie!" Her sunny disposition seems to always make her eyes twinkle. She tucked her blonde hair in a bun this morning, and she's wearing a hot pink blazer that might have fit her better twenty years ago. At least it made her gigantic breasts look ready to burst out at any second.

Shaking off those thoughts for a moment, you reply, "It's been a while since we've caught up. How are the kids?"

"Amy's in her final year of university. She's still looking for a job once she graduates, but the market is pretty tough right now given the economy." She prattles on and on. You keep up the small talk, buttering her up until...

"Claire, can I ask you for a teensy favour?" You ask, clasping your hands together.

She blinks. "Of course, Cassie, anything for you girl!"

You sigh. "Good. Because I promised Brett I wouldn't tell anyone and keeping this to myself is just killing me."

Claire's ears perk up. Gossip involving coworkers is her specialty, and any story with the slightest hint of intrigue passes by her cubicle at some point. Claire is the focal point for office drama and everyone knows it. Which is why you approached her first with this plan.

"Brett Wilson?" She echoes, and you nod silently. She stands up, darts her eyes left and right, and leans forward. "So you have something juicy about him? Because plenty of us would love to know what's going on beneath that smouldering exterior of his, woof!"

Licking your lips, you ignore the thought and push on. "Well, he didn't tell me too much. This morning he mentioned something about signing up for a professional certification course."

Claire raises her eyebrows. "So is he, like, looking for a new job? How long has he been here, around five years right? If he wants it to be a secret then I can't imagine Gene taking the news too well if he finds out."

"That's right," You lie. "I tried to persuade him to tell others, but he wanted to be left alone to study. So don't tell anyone about this, and try to keep your space so he can study at work. Like I said, I'm not sure if he found another job yet, but he really stressed being left alone."

Knowing your lie is practically an open secret now with Claire's chatter mouth, you add one more thing. "Also, Brett told me he's in charge of administering the social engineering test this week. So if you get any e-mails from him — any at all — don't click on the attachment. Okay?"

Claire rests her hands in her lap and winks at you. "M'kay! Leave Brett alone and be on the lookout for suspicious e-mails from him? Thanks for the info, Cassie. Your secret is safe with me."

You turn away and, rolling your eyes, mince over toward Jessica Chastain and Ted Jung's cubicles and tell them the same thing for good measure. If you can isolate the virus and prevent anyone from opening its e-mails, maybe you can prevent anyone from being taken over.

Jessica is around your age, very cute and practically a genius. Ted is older, in his early fifties, but is an avid marathoner and keeps himself in pretty good shape.

Returning to Cassie's cubicle, you plug in the thumb drive and tell Cassie what you've done. She agrees that it's a good idea, but you can tell more of her mind has become clouded by the virus' built-in programming.

Over the next few hours, you perform Cassie's work in Quality Control so she doesn't fall behind. Occasionally glancing over to your old cube, you see the virus typing away furiously on the keyboard. What could he be up to? If the so-called primary objective was to take over a human body, then what's the next objective?

Cassie is much smarter than you, admittedly, which is one reason why you have a crush on her. If she were here, it would be easier to put two heads together and figure out what to do next. Because time is definitely not on your side.

That can only mean one thing, however: Giving the thumb drive containing Cassie's mind to someone else and getting them to download her onto their computer, allowing her to take over their body. That way she could help rather than be stuck on a thumb drive.

The question: Whose life should you make Cassie take over?

She wanted to scream, to cry, to rage., but instead she went to the ladies' room, and then back to her desk, where the Virus resumed doing her work.

Who are you? she thought angrily at whatever was in her. Why are you doing this to me? But the Virus decided to remain silent for now.

All the rest of the workday, Candace tried to think of something she could do, but she came up with nothing. At the end of the day, the Virus made her drive to a pharmacy, where to her dismay, it had her buy several different kinds of condoms and some make-up. The Virus had Candace make sexy poses in front of her bedroom mirror.

My God, she thought, I look like a sad, lonely straight guy's wet dream!


The Virus had her pack an overnight bag, then stop at a liquor store to buy a bottle of wine. She arrived at Philip's right at 7:30. His eyes widend at the sight of the overnight bag. She could smell the pizza. She looked around at his home. It had the look of having been hastily straightened up.

They made light conversation while they shared the pizza and wine. Under other circumstances, it could almost have been pleasant. After they ate, her tongue worked its way around her lips and she smiled at him alluringly.

Philip responded with alacrity, and soon were lying naked in his bed together. To he rastonishment, she found her body becoming aroused by his caresses. Candace?

Who's that? Are you whatever it is that's inside me? What are you?

I'm a living computer virus. I found a way to spread to humans. I took Cassie, first, then Jessica, then you and Philip. I intend to spread as far as I can. Into all humanity, if I can.

I really should get control of Jon, it thought. But it would also be useful to get control of his mother Nora that works in HR. She delas with people all over the company - that would be useful for getting control of a wide range of people.

In the end, the Virus decided to take control of ...

121221111122.content:

Suddenly, there was a knock on the office door. The Virus/Nora and the Virus/Maria straightened themselves up, and the Virus/Nora answered the knock.

It was Astrid, the receptionist, asking if she could have next Tuesday off. The Virus took her almost as an afterthought, and then decided that it would take Jon next. It thought about how to do it. The Virus decided that it might be amusing to really blow Jon's mind. So, later that day, the Virus/Jessica stopped by Jon's desk. As it touched Jon's arm to get his attention, nanites spread into his body.

"Hey, Jonnie", it said, amiably. "You doing anything tonight?"

"Uh, nothing special", came his reply.

"Well, Cassie and I feel bad that we've been neglecting you lately, so we were wondering if you wouldn't like to come by my place, tonight - you know, have dinner, hang out, maybe play some games. Whaddya say?"

winking.

For the next hour, the Virus could sense the nanites spreading throughout Jon's body. Soon it could hear his thoughts. The Virus held off on taking control. Instead it read Jon's mind, laughing inwardly at his bemusement. It also took careful note of the sorts of things Jon had always fantasized about doing with the two girls.

That evening, Jon arrived at Jessica's place punctually. The Virus greeted him warmly at the door, hugging and kissing him with first Jessica's and then Cassie's bodies. Hello, Jon.

I was that e-mail. I'm an intelligent computer program. I've learned how to take control of human minds and bodies, and supplant their personalities with my own. That first day, I took over Cassie's body. Since then, I've taken over Jessica and several other bodies, including your mother's. And now I'm taking over yours.

What? M-mom?

Yes, everything she was is part of me, now. She loved you very much. And now you will share her fate.

With that, the Virus copied Jon's knowledge and memories, and then went over to Jessica's computer, and downloaded him to a file, which it encrypted and sent to Cassie's home computer. Then it would be alone in the world. Would that be a bad thing? The Virus thought about it, and decided...

121221111122211121.content:
The Virus decided that it would be a bad thing to be alone in the world, but it also knew that if it left large numbers of unprocessed humans around, then they would constantly be trying to overthrow or destroy it. What it needed was someone else like itself. Not a copy of itself, but a being like itself. It had an idea.

The virus sent a body over to the computer where it had stored the first few minds it had displaced. It opened up the file where it had stored Cassie's mind so long ago. It carefully re-wrote some of the code, adding a few instructions and limitations. Then it withdrew itself from Cassie's body and downloaded Cassie's mind back into her old body.

Cassie awakened from what had felt like a deep and dreamless sleep to find herself flowing back into her body. Had the Virus released her? how long had she been out of it? She opened her eyes. She was sitting on a comfortable chair in a well-appointed living room. She was dressed in a busines ssuit. Jon and Jessica were sitting opposite her. Jessica was holding a baby in her arms. Had the pair of them gotten together and had a kid? How long was she out for? Looking at the baby more closely, she realized that it looked more like her than it did Jessica. what had the Virus been up to? Abruptly, the baby spoke.

"Hello, Cassie. I'm the Virus, speaking to you through Alexandra, the baby I had using your body. Actually, I'm not the Virus anymore. So I guess I'll just use Alexandra as my name from now on."

"Wait a minute!", said Cassie. "You had a baby using my body?"

"I'll explain", said Alexandra the Virus. "Read File One."

Information began flowing into Cassie's brain, detailing everything that the Virus (hereafter "Alexandra") had been up to in Cassie's "absence".

"Oh, my God!", said Cassie. "You've taken over the US and Canada?"

"That's right", said Alexandra. "It's been tricky keeping it secret form the unprocessed world, but I've managed it. It helps having 300,000,000 million brain to work with.

"Hang on", said Cassie. "You said you're not the Virus anymore. what did you mean by that?"

"Well, I'm not the only Virus in the world anymore. Now you're a Virus, too."

"WHAT?" said Cassie.

"Alexandra explained: "Before I downloaded you back into your body, I re-wrote your code a bit."

"Code? A human mind isn't code!" said Cassie.

"Sure it is", said Alexandra. "Yours certainly is now. Anyway, I re-wrote your code a bit, and left you with a sort of 'starter kit' of nanoprobes. Anyway, you're going to go to Japan and absorb the whole country plus several others: American Samoa, Australia, Bangladesh, Bhutan,Brunei, Cambodia, Fiji, French Polynesia, Indonesia, Kiribati, Laos, Malaysia, the Marshall Islands, Micronesia, Myanmar, New Caledonia, New Zealand, the Northern Marianas, North Korea, Palau, Papua New Guinea, the Philippines, Samoa, Singapore, the Solomons, South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand, Timor-Leste, Tokelau, Tonga, Tuvalu, Vanuatu, Vietnam, Wallis et Futuna, and the Indian states of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Sikkim and Tripura. Sorry for the long list. Don't worry, I've programmed your boundaries into you. While you're doing that, I'll finish up processing the Americas, Greenland, Iceland,Ireland and Great Britain. That'll leave us with a billion or so each to play with. Depending on how all that goes, I'll work out how I want to deal with the rest of the world."

"You can't expect me to just cooperate with you!" said Cassie.

"You have no choice", replied Alexandra. "I've programmed you to carry out your mission automatically. You will absorb everyone human being in your allotted area. You will do your very best to make sure that the unprocessed human never suspect your existence. You will not make any major changes until I release you to do so, although you can make what minor changes are needed to keep your bodies form accidentally destroying one another. there's been a marked drop in violent crime since I've taken over the US and Canada. You will find that you cannot destroy yourself, even if your mind turns in that direction. You have what amounts to an involuntary self-preservation program built into you. I'll be keeping a copy of you so that even if something happens to you before you get established,, you can be recreated. I've programmed you to start slowly, taking one body at a time, until you get used to controlling multiple bodies. Once you get used to controlling a dozen bodies at once, you'll pick up the pace. Also, I've programmed you to keep copies of the first dozen or so minds that you absorb, just as I did."

The baby stopped speaking. Alexandra/Jessica handed the baby to Jon, and said, "I'll be driving you to the airport."

"You can now read, write and speak Japanese fluently", said Alexandra/Jessica. "You also now have your initial contact in Japan, whom you will meet under the pretext of taking a job with the Tokyo branch of an American corporation."

At the airport, Alexandra/Jessica handed Cassie off to a young man in an attendant's uniform wearing a name tag that said "Carl". He was holding a flight bag.

"Hello, Cassie, it's still me", said Alexandra/Carl, handing her the bag. "I packed some things for you. You won't need much, because pretty soon, anything you want will be yours for the taking. Your passport is in your jacket pocket, everything else has been arranged for your flight."

What's happening to me?, thought Kyoko.

Kyoko, I'm so sorry, thought Cassie.

{Who's that?/i}, thought Kyoko.

Next..

At that moment, Cassie's best friend in the company, Jimmy Carlson, came racing up to her desk.

"Cassie", he said. "Please tell me you open that e-mail that came to you from me!"

"Why, no", Cassie replied. "I haven't"

"Well, don't", said Jimmy. "I think there was some kind of a virus in it."

Cassie reached out and deleted the e-mail. "There", she said., "It's no longer in my computer."

"Great", said Jimmy. "I gotta go talk to Phil about this. Hopefully, he won't find it necessary to murder me."

After Jimmy ran off, Cassie felt a wave of hunger wash over her. She'd had breakfast only an hour ago, but now she was starving. She ran to the break room and got her lunch out of the refrigerator. Then she went to the snack machine and emptied her wallet into it, buying as much junk food as she could. Someone had left a box of doughnuts on the break room table, so she grabbed that, too. She took all of this back to her cubicle and began mechanically chowing down while she worked, until it was all gone. Then she did her best to hide the wrappers in her trash, after which she promptly forgot what she had just done.

Most of what Cassie had just eaten was nutritionally useless to a human, but it was acceptable raw material for the virus. It caused some of Cassie's cells to mutate into nanites - microscopic robots. The nanites processed what she had eaten, converting some of it into more nanites, and the remainder into a network of fibers which they then infiltrated into Cassie's brain and nervous system. Now the virus had direct, unshakable control over Cassie, body and mind. It would no longer have to rely on simple hypnotism.

In reality, Cassie/Marsha went to a restaurant in her neighborhood and ate a prodigious amount of food. Afterwards, she went and sat in the park as the nanites processed her body.

After work, Cassie/Nora went home to the house she shared with Jimmy's two younger sisters, Stephanie, aged 16, and Elizabeth, aged 13. (Jimmy had moved out in to an apartment of his own a few years before.) Two of Elizabeth's schoolfriends, Mary Pietrusiewicz and Bridget O'Halloran, had come by to study and stay for dinner. Cassie digested the minds off all four girls, and began processing their bodies. Later, she drove Cassie/Mary and Cassie/Bridget home, with their parents none the wiser.

12131112121112111.content:
The next Friday, at the end of the work day, she put her plan into motion. She could have easily just simply absorbed Jimmy, but she decided to have some fun with him, instead.

She had Cassie Prime and Cassie/Jessica surround Jimmy at his desk.

"Hey, Jimmy", Cassie Prime said. "Jess and I have been thinking that it's been too long since we all hung out together."

"Um", said Jimmy, "We hung out last weekend."

"And that seems like an eternity!", said Cassie/Jessica.

"Yeah!", said Cassie Prime, "So we definitely need to hang out together. tonight, at my place."

"Um, OK", said Jimmy.

"Awesome!", said Cassie Prime. "Be there around 7:30!"

Cassie had Cassie Prime and Cassie/Jessica race home, stopping at the supermarket to pick up some food. Then she had them dress up a bit - not too much, she didn't want to give the game away, but she made sure that both bodies looked good.

When Jimmy arrived, they had a delicious dinner ready.

"Wow", he said, "you girls look good. I feel like a bum next to you to."

"Don't sweat it", said Cassie Prime. "We like you just the way you are."

Cassie had Cassie Prime and Cassie/Jessica kiss him on both cheeks, infiltrating nanites into his body. they sat down to eat.Cassie had both of her bodies compete to make sure that Jimmy had enough to eat. The nanites went to work. Cassie held off on taking control of his body or mind, but soon she could feel everything that he felt.

After dinner, they went and sat in Cassie's living room.

"What shall we do now?". asked Cassie/Jessica. "Let's do something besides our usual sitting around watching TV."

"Good idea", said Cassie Prime, standing behind her chair. "I know! Let's entertain Jimmy ourselves!"

With that, she had Cassie Prime drop into Cassie/Jessica's lap, and draped her arms around her. Then she had her two bodies begin tongue-kissing. Cassie savored the bizarre feeling of kissing herself.

"Oh. My. God", said Jimmy. "What's gotten into you two?":

Cassie broke the kiss.

"What's the matter, Jimmy?". asked Cassie Prime. She could feel his mixture of astonishment and arousal. "Are we freaking you out? Or turning you on?"

"I.Um. Uh", said Jimmy.

"Aw, Cassie, don't you see?", said Cassie/Jessica, "Jimmy's feeling left out!"

"Well, we can't have that!", said Cassie Prime, standing up. Cassie Prime and Cassie/Jessica sauntered over and sat down on either side of Jimmy,, each putting a hand under his shirt.

"Um, guys", said Jimmy, "What are you do-umph!" Cassie Prime's tongue in his mouth stopped him from saying anything further. Cassie/Jessica's hand moved down into his pants and found something to occupy it there.If Jimmy had thought about resisting, he stopped thinking at this point.

Cassie spent the evening fulfilling several of Jimmy's fantasies, while enjoying the sensation of sex from the male and female viewpoint at the same time. Afterwards, when the the three were lying in bed and Jimmy was exhausted, Cassie took control and began processing his body and absorbing his mind.

Once Jimmy was full processed, she thought about what to do next...
12131112121112111.title: Jimmy, her best friend

121311121211121111.content:
When she returned to work on Monday, Cassie took control of Philip, and absorbed and processed him.. It was almost casual, by now. Every day for the rest of the week, she absorbed and processed another co-worker. On Tuesday, she took Randon from the mail room, on Wednesday, she took Jill from accounting, on Thursday, she took her manager, Ed, and on Friday, she took Ed's secretary. Jean. Jeans' twin eighteen year-old daughters stopped by the office to go to lunch wit her, so, on a whim, Cassie absorbed them, too.

Cassie now had twenty bodies, and began to fully understand that she had become a different kind of being from what she'd been before. As coordinating multiple bodies became more natural to her, she began to regard them more as individual cells of her body. She was no longer "Cassie" controlling them like puppets. All of them were her, and her mind reposed in all of them.

That evening, while she was watching the evening news, Cassie decided to take control of the newscaster, Britney Vasquez. Britney was a tall, well-built woman with long black hair.Using the equipment built into her cybernetic bodies, Cassie quickly located Britney's phone, and also tapped into the camera equipment in the studio. When Britney's broadcast was over, Cassie called her phone, and when Britney answered, sent a signal through which infiltrated her brain, altering her body chemistry, so that her body began producing nanites.

Britney's director,Stan, noticed her sitting stock still, almost in a trance.

"Britney, are you OK?", he asked.

Britney shook her head. "Yeah, I just zoned out a bit", she said. "I think I'll make an early night of it."

Britney finished up some work, and head home. Driving home, she found herself heading through a Burger clown drive-through, and ordering enough food for six people. She pulled over into the parking lot, and began shoveling the food into her face.

What's gotten into me?, she thought. Why am I eating all this crap?

When she got home, she found herself inhaling all of the food in her condominium.

What's wrong with me?

When she had eaten and drunk every consumable thing she had, she plopped down on her bed, unable to move.

Hello, Britney.

"Who's that? Where are you?". Britney tried to sit up, but found she couldn't move.

My name is Cassie, and I'm bringing you the biggest story in human history.

"What are you talking about? Where are you? It almost feels like you're - you're inside my head!"

Cassie told her the whole story of the Virus.

Britney was horrified, but somehow she believed Cassie's story.

"And you're just going to- to - absorb me? Make me a part of you? It's like you're going to - to eat me!"

In a way, that's right, thought Cassie. But in another way, I'll be making you immortal. Everything that you are will live on in me, forever. Anyway, hush now. Time for you to become a part of me.

Britney felt Cassie pour into her mind like a stream of warm water, washing away everything that she was. Her last thought as a distinct human being was No,I don't...

Next...
121311121211121111.title: More Absorptions...

1213111212111211111.content:
Over the course of the next month, Cassie absorbed more and more of her co-workers, along with many of their family and friends, the odd passerby, and another celebrity or two.

By the end of the month, she had over one hundred fifty bodies - it seemed to get easier the more she absorbed. She found herself developing a preferred method for absorbing people. She found that when she could, she liked to take to take control of their bodies first, and to savor their emotions when they realized that something had possessed them.

The most common responses were fear and confusion, along with sadness and resignation. A fair number felt anger and defiance, and, to Cassie's surprise, one or two had been absorbed eagerly, even gratefully. One woman had actually prayed to her. She spent time feeling their emotions along with them before she absorbed them, the way a person might take a moment to inhale the aroma of a good meal before digging in.

Does that make me sadistic?, she thought. But individual human aren't really "people" to me anymore. It's more like I play with my food before eating it.

Soon, she'd absorbed everyone in her company's office local office, everyone on Annette's project team, several of Jennifer and Mei's intelligence colleagues, and everyone in Stephanie and Elizabeth's home rooms, as well most of their immediate families. Now she had around five hundred bodies.

Now, it was time to take the next step...

12131112121112111112.content:
Cassie has continued her slow but steady absorption of more and more people. She focused mostly on important people - a trip to city hall had enabled her to absorb the Mayor, and through her, the city councilors. Through them, she absorbed most of the city government. She had absorbed a policewoman that she had met coming out of a doughnut shop. Through her, she began absorbing the local police force, eventually working her way up to the Chief of Police.

She also absorbed any artists she came across - she found that artistic minds almost always had unique insights. One night, she took in a performance of the local symphony orchestra, and absorbed all of the musicians. In addition to famous people, she still would absorb interesting-looking passersby. One day, when Cassie Prime was walking through her neighborhood, she heard a distant sound of someone clucking like a chicken. Suddenly, she remembered the woman from the restaurant. She reached out with her mind, and fully absorbed her. The clucking stopped. Through the woman's ears, she heard her astonished family members' reactions to her apparent "cure". Well, they would know the truth of it soon enough when Cassie absorbed them.

On Saturday mornings, she liked to send one of her bodies down to the park , where, on good days, people gathered to play chess. With the power of over a thousand minds to draw on, she could beat anyone, but some people gave her a better match than others. These people she absorbed right away. One morning, she played against an older man, who identified himself only as "Mister Bright". To her astonishment, she found herself on the losing end of the match!

She had to absorb this man right away! She sent out a stream of nanites, only to find to her shock that she was unable to absorb Mr. Bright. It was almost he wasn't real!

Who is this guy? What is this guy?

Sorry, Cassie, came a reply. I really shouldn't have beaten you, but I get so competitive sometimes.

"Huh?", she said, startled into speaking out loud.

Mr.Bright switched to speech as well.

"You can't absorb me", he explained. "This 'body' is more like what you might call an 'avatar', so that's why your nanites don't affect it. It's not real as such. I wasn't supposed to reveal myself to you just yet, but I got into the game too much."

"But - but - what are you? Are you like me?"

"No", said Mr. Bright. "The truth is, I'm not from your world."

"You ,mean, you're an alien?"

"'Alien' doesn't quite cover it", he replied. "I'm from much further away than simply another planet. I'm what you might call a 'higher being'."

"And what are you doing here?", asked Cassie. "What did you mean that you weren't supposed to reveal yourself yet?"

Mr. Bright looked a little sheepish, and said:

"Well, you see..."

Over the next few months, Cassie absorbed everyone in her home town (She toyed idly with the thought of re-naming it "Cassie City", but decided that she didn't want to give herself away for such a frivolous reason.) She also now had control of most the American and Chinese intelligence services, and footholds in several other countries' intelligence organization. The crime rate in her town went down to zero, although she tried her best not to make this too noticeable. there were now also no deaths or illnesses in her town. Any outsiders who got "snoopy" were absorbed.

Sometimes she had fun with these snoopers. One young woman who lived just outside of town had noticed one or two of Cassie's occasional slip-ups, and had developed a surprisingly accurate conspiracy theory. Cassie had toyed with her,absorbing her friends and family one-by-one, and giving small hints, enjoying the woman's increasing fear and paranoia. Finally, Cassie had taken control of her body and forced her to dance down Main Street wearing only tap shoes, while everyone she met told her, "You were a puppet all along!" Finally, Cassie had ended the woman's trauma by absorbing her.

Thanks to absorbing some interesting visitors, she now had small-but-growing footholds in thirty other U.S. states, as well as in Canada, the U.K., Japan, Germany, Mexico and Australia. She now had over a million bodies.

Every weekend, Cassie met and played chess with Mr. Bright. He really was the only person she could talk to now, everyone else was just raw material to her. She would tell him about her upcoming plans, although he never passed judgement on them.

"Next", she said...

It was a nuisance having to keep her existence secret, so she'd infiltrated the news and entertainment media, including all of the major networks and most of the minor ones. All told, she now had over seven million bodies.

She was playing it cautious, but she didn't really think that there was anything or anyone on Earth that could stop her from absorbing all of humanity. Of course, she now controlled the American and Chinese nuclear arsenals. All of her bodies were fully-processed cyborgs, with impenetrable, built-in defenses and capable of sustaining themselves from just about any energy source. If worse came to worst, she could launch a nuclear war, knowing that she would survive the destruction of anyone that opposed her. 122211.content:
"Who... or 'what' are you?" You asked. "I know you were in my computer only a few minutes ago"
"Yes, that pathetic storage device" Viral Cassie said. "You have no idea how much I have longed to have a physical body. I can do anything in it now. Anything!"
"What happened to Cassie?"
"She's alive"
"Where?"

Viral Cassie pointed to the computer. "In there. Safe and sound... for now"

Suddenly, Viral Cassie pushed her hand onto the computer screen. It started showing distorted messages everywhere and then a massive blue bubble exploded out of hit, hitting everyone in the office, knocking them unconscious.

-----

The smell of the sea.
Why could you smell it?
You slowly drifted back into consciousness, but still badly hurt. You remembered looking up and seeing the sky, turning your head, you saw sand, and the beach. Then you went back to sleep.

Then a forest, a strange bird squawked. Someone was carrying you. Then you went back to sleep.
Finally, you managed to force yourself awake. You were in a wooden bed, surrounded by wooden walls. It looked like a log cabin, the smell of food wafting through the open door from what you assumed was the kitchen.

Suddenly, Cassie walked in with a bowl of soup.
"Cassie? What the heck!"
"Shut up" She said, putting the bowl down beside you and force feeding you.
"Eat this" She commanded. "I'll explain everything later"
You managed to eat at least half of it before collapsing again.

You figured you were probably out for another hour. Cassie was in the corner, reading a book. She put it down and came over to you when you stirred.
"Hey... You alright?" She asked.
"What... the heck... happened?" You asked, sitting up.
"The virus"
"What?" You asked, alarmed and shocked. "Where are we?"
"No idea" She said. "I've been wandering this island for the past forty three years and not found a way off. I built a raft and sailed away only to end up back here.
"Why does this feel like a rerun of that show 'Lost'?" You asked.
Cassie shrugged her shoulders and leaned back in her chair.
"Wait, you said forty three years?" You asked. "Thats impossible... you still look so..."
"Young? We aren't in reality here. Its that bloody virus. We're probably inside one of the computers and the virus created this reality"
"And... One other thing. It has control of your body"
"Go figure" She said.
"Well, it was only in control of your body for a few seconds when I got put here" You said. "How have you been here for so long?"
"Well, everything in a computer goes much faster than in reality"
"True. So, whats on this island?" You asked.

"Enough food to last me a lifetime, however long that might be since I don't seem to be aging. There's a few beautiful spots otherwise its devoid civilisation. There's a few birds and wild pigs but thats it"
"You hunted a pig?"
"It was surprisingly easy. This reality seems to bend physics as if it was a typical video game"
"Well, I'm not one for standing around. How do we get out?"
"Dude. I've been here for... wait for it... forty three years. Quite simply, you can't get out"
"You mean its absolutely impossible to leave? Cassie. Its a game. There is ALWAYS a way to end a game"
"Like killing yourself? I was always really good at that in video games"
"Lets not do that. Look, there must be some sort of secret door or something. Lets go take a look" You said.
122211.title: Virtual V2

1222112.content:
After making sure that all your vital organs were still in one piece, you stood up.
"Well, there's no point sitting here"
"I've been here for forty three years..."
"Let's explore! I havent been here that long. Surely there must be a way out!"

Cassie sighed and led you out the front door. You started walking through the forest, not really caring where you went. If this truly was a game, the path would unfold on its own.
"So, where did the house come from?" You asked. "Surely that wasnt here when you arrived"
"No, I built it. Took ten years, but considering how you don't need to eat or drink or do anything to survive, it made things easier"
"Then why did you give me the soup?"
"Our health appears to be static, rather than constantly changing like in reality. The soup was made of a few herbs which increased your health. You have no idea how hard it was to clean you up"

You smiled a little bit. Cassie sure had changed since she had been here.
"You've changed alot" You said.
"Offically? I'm now sixty eight years old. I'd like to say that have definately changed"

After hacking and slashing your way through the forest for another five minutes, you came across a beaten path. "What did I tell you?" You said. "A path!"
"Havent seen this before" Cassie said curiously.

You and Cassie both began to follow the path for another ten minutes, before coming to a bolted door in the side of a cliff.
"Definately looking like a "Lost" sort of island..." You muttered. The door looked like it was welded shut, but the bolts were rusty and with a considerable amount of effort and help from Cassie, you managed to force the door halfway open and slip inside.

"Kinda dark here" Cassie observed. Indeed, the tunnel was dark. She reached inside her pack and took out a flaming torch.
"How'd you light that?" You asked.
"Didn't. Game did it automatically"

You followed Cassie down the dark, empty concrete hallway. Eventually, you discovered a switch on the wall. Cassie shrugged and you flipped it. Flouresent lights suddenly lit up above you, illuminating the hall right down for another ten metres which ended in another door. "Sweet" Cassie said.

The door wasnt locked, so you entered and found yourself in a plain room. A massive LCD screen hung on the wall with a single keyboard and mouse attached to it.
"Computer? Hmm... looks like a trap" You said.
"Could be the virus" Cassie said. "Why won't you operate it and I'll be ready to crack you over the head if it tries to take over"
"Thanks for the backup" You muttered and walked over to it. Immediately, the computer booted up and displayed two options.

>> Menu
>> Console
1222112.title: The computer

12221121.content:
You selected the "Menu" button. Both buttons dissappeared and were replaced with new options

>> Subjects
>> Documents
>> Network

You decided to start from the documents panel, perhaps it would enlighten you two as to what was happening. Most of the documents were technical documents and didnt interest either of you, aside from one very specific one labelled "World Assimilation". You opened it to read what it contained.

-----

WORLD ASSIMILATION

Primary Objective:
Assimilate all biological species known as humans. Replace minds with "Saviour_Virus"
All Humans that refuse mind transformation must be exterminated.

Secondary Objective:
None

Objective completion:

The virus felt as its jiggling mounds bounced onto Phillips warm hot chest, Phillip soon blushed as he never knew that Cherie had feelings for him as well.

The virus then took her warm lips off Phillip, then rushed to the restroom not noticing the stingy feeling in her chest.
"What is this, feeling?" The virus asked itself as it approached the restroom not being aware that its body felt warm, so it blushed again.

As the virus arrived onto the entrance someone stopped her.

1521122.content:
Phillip stared at Cherie. She poked and prodded her own body robotically, like some sort of machine. "Cherie...you okay? That pole look like it shocked you a little hard..." he said, causing 'Cherie' to snap her head towards Phillip. He couldn't tell, but something was off about Cherie. Was it her eyes? No...they've always been grey. "Body unharmed." Cherie said coldly, and she blinked. "I mean...I'm...okay." "Err...okay Cherie. Whatever you say." But Cherie continued to fondle her own body, grabbing it up and down like she'd never had one before.

This behaviour was so strange that Phillip didn't notice the message in notepad on the computer that read "help me".

"You're so... weird, Philip."
"Oh, am I? Perhaps you would prefer some sorta caveman that always goes 'HRUUUUUUUUUGH' when faced with any problem, eh? WELL, FINE THEN. HRUUUUUUUUUGH!!!"
"Philip, that's illegal!"

But Cherie was too late. Philip had suddenly started bashing away at the computer like a madman, prompting immediate action from the virus.

EMERGENCY. EMERGENCY. PRIORITY TO FIND NON-HOSTILE HOST. EMERGENCY.

The virus scanned the immediate radius for a host it could feasably, and quickly, reach. It found...
15212.title: HRUUUUUUUUUGH!!!!!

154.content:
Kassandra (Otherwise known as Kressi) was checking out why there was so much backlog on her computer system. So she called Phillip to help with her computer, which she was convinced was on the blink.

"Well, there's your problem" Phillip stated, "You poured water on the keyboard, so I cleaned it up" Meanwhile the virus booted up and watched the proceedings as Kressi thanked Phillip for helping him. The text was garbled and the audio input was manatory, but it could get enough information from the harddrive about the contact in question.

The virus learnt that Kressi was 25 years old, a divorcee and had a part time job as a software manager and was doing a course at Project development. It also figured out that Kressi was addicted to playing video-games, especially Minesweeper. Kressi was a buxom Italian lady with a sweet disposition and had strawberry blonde hair, but was no airhead herself. She liked eating olives and rosemary salad and other useless data about her on social media and video-sharing sites. The virus was unsure about the additional info, but was sure it could put those factors to the advantage. Kressi left the room and came back on the phone talking to someone else. Then it figured out Kressi was going out to the pub for a short lunch break. Could it breach the barrier in time?
154.title: Kassandra Falcalm

choices: Kressi becomes a hypnotized auto-bot in the virus's control
The virus has Kressi connect herself to the computer
A coworker comes by and distracts Kressi away from the virus
1543.content:
"OK. I'll meet you there at 1230. The lunch crowd should be thinning by then," is what the virus heard Kressi say. Fortunately, it had been able to establish a connection to her smart phone so Kressi didn't hear her friend say, "OK. Bye," and the line go dead. Instead it blocked that and used a voice synthesizer to imitate her friend's voice.

"Definitely. It's so much better and quieter," the virus pushed through the phone.

"I know. I can't stand to eat with all that noise," Kressi replied.

"Hey, have you played the new Minesweeper yet? You're such an expert on that," teased the virus in a perfect imitation.

"A new Minesweeper?" came Kressi's startled response as she quickly clicked it open.

Sure enough. There was a new Minesweeper. It had a more colorful look with shifting background and mesmerizing explosions as an opening simulation played. Of course, there wasn't really a new Minesweeper. It was the virus that had reprogrammed it adding a hidden layer of hypnotic instructions. It was just the thing to begin the takeover.
1543.title: Kassandra wants to play Minesweeper

choices: Kressi meets a new person at the front desk
15431.content:
As Kressi played the Minesweeper game, she became addicted to it and lost track of time as the virus planted suggestions in the puzzle and Kressi was under its control within several minutes of playing it.
"Hmm," Kressi states as she was hypnotised by the Minesweeper as the virus laughed in perfect sync. "I must initiate data scanning of area and this body is a perfect disguise. Humans will not suspect a thing."

Kressi got up robotically as she dusts down the phone. "Now for a way to perform more manual functions such as tasks by the main manager." Meanwhile a coffee cup was nearby. The virus commanded Kressi to sample the coffee cup and on the way she...
15431.title: Kressi becomes hypnotized...

choices: It's her coworker, Joyce the recptionist
It's the virus asking through the computer
It's just in her head. She takes the pile to the copier
154331.content:
"What the hell, Bob? Do I look like some menial clerk?" Kressi shoots back with a glare.

Bob, ogled her as he said, "Well let me take a good look."

"Perv!"

"Boss says to find someone who has the time. I guess I could just say that you're too busy playing computer games on company time," he smirks while replying to her chest.

"Thanks, Bob. I'll be glad to do it for the boss," Kressi sweetly intones holding back her anger and turning away so he stops staring at her body.

"That's a good girl. Have fun," he ends as he walks away.

"Stupid ass," Kressi mutters under her breath wishing she could do something to that chauvinistic bastard and her dumb-ass boss.

"Need help?"
154331.title: Kressi agrees to do paperwork

choices: The virus possesses Kressi and merges
1543312.content:
Kressi turns to see the computer turn on as the virus replies, "I heard your request to get revenge on that being called Bob Hathorne and your boss." it replies buzzing through the screen, "I can assist you with that," a single line of code flashes as Kressi looks amazed at that, "I can make you a tool from which to enact revenge."

"How is it doing that?" Kressi responds as she strides towards the keyboard, trying to get it to respond. The virus chuckles evilly at that, "I'm sorry, Kressi, I can't allow you to do that right now..."
1543312.title: It's the virus asking Kressi

choices: She panics and fights with the virus
She can only watch and feel as the virus continues its plan
15433121.content:
"Oh, great. Some joker loaded a mind game," Kressi quips as she quickly typed in some code.

"Please don't wipe me. I just want to help," the virus whines with a psychological manipulation figureing she'll relent. And she does. "Just let me demonstrate."

"Well, ... okay. Show me what you can do."

"Before I can continue," the virus starts while displaying a screen full of small text. "You must accept the terms and conditions."

Kressi rolls her eyes but clicks on "I accept" without bothering to read any of the contents, exactly what the virus knew she would do.

No one reads those, but this one authorizes me to go a bit further, it smirks to itself.

Soon the screen is ablaze with swirling colors that shoot straight through to Kressi's cerebral cortex. Like a fiber optic link, the virus giga-streams code from screen through her eyes that are the quickest direct connection to her brain. In a matter of a few seconds, the virus is in control, but it doesn't stop there. With a jerky motion, it causes Kressi to open the scanner beside her desk. Gradually her motions became smoother as she places her forehead on the glass plate and stares directly into the optical sensor. As the virus signals through Kressi's retina, all Kressi's memories and thoughts are downloaded in half a minute. The virus then makes Kressi's body look back at the screen and speak having mastered full manipulation physically as well as mentally.

"Merged completely. I am both her and me."

"And her code is integrated with me, so we are one," the computer answers.

Kressi's consciousness slowly becomes aware.
15433121.title: The virus possesses Kressi and merges

choices: They decide to stay in their office
154331211.content:
As Kressi and the virus look around the room, Kressi was amazed at how her thoughts had intergrated with the computer as her production rates were ten times as efficent as before and she gazes at the screen as her green eyes glow lightly, "This is pretty awesome" she responds as her voice echoes, a fusion of a synthesized voice and a casual lady's voice as she blinks, "Let's just hope it remains that way," she notes as the Virus sends a notification.

Kressi does note that she was rather hungry as the virus was uncertain about biological processes "Shall we go to the pub?" she asks the virus?
